questions.text: A patient presented with pain in right upper quadrant on fifth post operative day, following Lap Cholecystectomy. She is icteric and On Ultrasound there is collection seen in the Morrison's pouch. Biliary leak is suspected. What is the most sensitive investigation to detect biliary leak
questions.solution:
HIDA scan is the most sensitive investigation to detect biliary leak,

ERCP is preferred to detect the anatomical site of leak and is both diagnostic and therapeutic

questions.text: A young male smoker with intermittent pain in the calf, On examination has a painful ulcer at the tip of great toe, surrounded by blackened skin. Best initial investigation in this case would be -
questions.solution:
History of young male smoker with claudication and ulcer with blackened skin points towards Buergers Disease or Thromboangitis Obliterans and best initial investigation is Duplex doppler ultrasound that shows serpentine collaterals and vessel narrowing.

DSA shows corkscrew collaterals

questions.text:
Which of the following investigations can be used in osteoporosis
1) DEXA scan
2) Quantitative CT scan
3) Bone scan
4) Serum Chemical Analysis
questions.solution:
DEXA scan is Gold standard for Detecting Bone mineral density in osteoporosis

Quantitative CT scan is better at looking at Bone mineral density especially of trabecular bone and cortical bone separately

Serum Analysis of calcium,phosphate,alkaline phosphatase is important to rule out secondary causes of decreased bone mineral density like hyperparathyroidism

questions.text: A year old child presented with anemia, hepatosplenomegaly, cervical lymphnodes and multiple scalp swellings and with the given skull radiograph. Which of the following drug is commonly used in this scenario?
questions.solution: The image shows Hole within hole appearance of skull lesions with bevelled edges suggestive of Langerhans cell Histiocytosis and Vinblastine and Steroids are used in the treatment

questions.text: A 55-year-old patient with history of peptic ulcer disease was having abdominal pain and distension since many days. It gets worse since last two hours. BP-90/40 and Abdominal radiograph is shown here. What is to be done in this patient ?
questions.solution: The CXR Shows air under rt dome of diaphragm suggestive of hollow viscus perforation,Iv fluids and emergency laparotomy is indicated

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient with progressive dysphagia to both solids and liquids for 8 months. BMI -18.5 ,emaciated no systemic illness Barium swallow was done and shown below. What other investigations should be done in this patient?
questions.solution: The image shows Achalasia cardia and Manometry with UGIE to rule out malignancy and secondary causes is advised.

choices.text: Immediately shift the patient to OT for thoracotomy
Insert a Large bore needle in the 5th Intercostal space followed by ICD in 5th Intercostal space

questions.text: A 25-year-old male patient came to emergency after road traffic accident, Respiratory rate is 35/min, and BP-100/60mm Hg and difficulty in speaking sentences. On percussion, hyper resonant note is seen on entire right side of the chest. FAST is performed and is normal, Chest x-ray was given below. What is the initial next line of management of this patient?
questions.solution: The cxr shows Rt sided Pneumothorax and Insertion of wide bore needle followed by ICD in 5th ICS is advised

questions.text: A 40-year-old male with progressive forward bending with increasing stiffness of the spine. A Ct-spine was performed and shown below. What is the most Likely Diagnosis-
questions.solution: The saggital ct shows decreased intervertebral disc space,carrot stick fracture and osteopaenia suggestive of Ankylosing spondylitis

questions.text: Which area is evaluated along with Abdomen during E-Fast?
questions.solution: In Efast along with FAST views anterior thorasic views are obtained to rule out pneumothorax

questions.text: A 40 year old male patient with 2 year history of mucopurulent cough underwent a CT -chest. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: The image shows cystic bronchiectasis involving left lower lobe

questions.text: The radiograph shown below is done for better assessment of the frontal sinus. What is the common name of this view ?
questions.solution: The image shows Frontal sinus on Caldwell View

questions.text: Following appearance of Brain on MRI is seen with
questions.solution:
• Lissencephaly-Axial T2-weighted image shows complete absence of sulci with a thick cortex, a shallow Sylvian fissure
  • Lissencephaly is a type of neuronal migration disorder with lack of development of gyri and sulci giving a smooth outline to the brain giving a characteristic Hour Glass or Figure of 8 appearence

questions.text: A Young Female with Hypertension Shows the following angiographic findings, Probable Diagnosis is?
questions.solution:
• Fibromuscular dysplasia is a characterised by an idiopathic, non-inflammatory,non-atherosclerotic angiopathy of small and medium-sized arteries.

More common in young women, typically diagnosed between the ages of 30 and 50

questions.text: Half life of 18F used in Pet scan is
Tubular artery sign is seen in
questions.solution:
Signs of pneumomediastinum

  • Continuous Diaphgram Sign
  • Spinnaker Sign/Angel Wing Sign
  • Tubular artery sign
  • Ring around artery sign
  • Double bronchial wall sign

questions.text: Which of the following water soluble radiocontrast agent has highest osmolality?
questions.solution: Ionic Monomer has highest Osmolality with Iodine:particle Ratio of 3:2

questions.text: Steirlin sign on Barium Study is a feature of?
questions.solution: Rapid emptying of barium from diseased segment is called Sterlin sign seen in ileocecal Tuberculosis

questions.text: Which of the following is not an USG sign of Pneumothorax?
questions.solution:
• Sliding sign –sliding of parital and visceral pleura –normal
  • Absent sliding-Pneumothorax
  • Comet tail artifacts-B lines-NORMAL REVERBERATION ARTIFACTS,
  • Absent comet Tail sign/Absent B lines -pneumothorax
  • Seashore sign –Normal
  • Absent Seashore sign-Pneumothorax
  • Quad sign-Pleural effusion on static Usg
  • Sinusoid Sign-Pleural Effusion On M mode

questions.text: A Skull radiograph of Child with seizures and mental retardation is shown, probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Tram Track Calcifications –Sturge weber syndrome

questions.text: Following Ct scan Image Suggests?
questions.solution: • Hyperdense MCA sign refers to focal increased density of the middle cerebral artery (MCA) on CT and is a direct visualization of thromboembolic material within the lumen, Suggestive of Acute Mca THROMBUS

questions.text: A Ct Angiogram image of a child with high output cardiac failure is given, it suggests the diagnosis of?
questions.solution: • CT cerebral angiogram shows an aneurysmal deep venous structure which drains to the vein of Galen.

questions.text: This MRI Of a 5year old Boy with progressive motor and cognitive and visual defects suggests
questions.solution:
• Adrenoleukodystrophy is a X linked Recessive condition, common in Males
  • The conditions result from the accumulation of very long-chain fatty acids (VLCFAs) due to genetic deficiency in the peroxisomal oxidation of fatty acids.
  • There deep white matter in the b/l parieto-occipital lobes and splenium of the corpus callosum is affected early

questions.text: 25 year old young male presenting with abdominal pain after sustaining blunt trauma to his abdomen during a road traffic accident, has a BP-120/80 and a pulse of 72bpm, The next best step in management of this patient is?
questions.solution:
• Initial Investigation in a patient with abdominal trauma Usg to detect hemoperitoneum
  • Investigation of choice to know the source of hemoperitoneum in a stable patient is Cect-Abdomen

The next line of management in this patient should be to do FAST(USG)

questions.text: Myocardial Viability is best evaluated by?
questions.solution:
• Thallium-201,Sestamibi,Tetrofosmin scan are suggestive of Myocardial Perfusion Imaging
  • Pyrophosphate scan of Myocardial Infarction.
  • 18FDG Pet is used to detect Myocardial Viability

questions.text: Dependant Viscera sign is seen in?
questions.solution:
• Dependent viscera sign is seen in Diaphgramatic Injury
  • Viscera lie against the posterior ribs with obliteration of posterior costophrenic recess on a CT

choices.text: Subacute combined degeneration of Spinal Cord

questions.text: A 57 year old male presents with progressive atrophy of his hands and forearms and spasticity of his lower limbs with hyperreflexia, T2W Mri Shows high signal in Corticospinal tracts, most likely diagnosis is?
questions.solution: • The clinical features suggest of A Motor neuron disease and Bilateral corticospinal tract hyperintensities on MRI are Seen in Amyotropic Lateral Sclerosis.

questions.text: 35 year old presenting with abdominal pain
questions.solution: Body packer is a drug smuggler with internal concealment of Drugs in GI tract and the drug packets appear as multiple uniform well defined radioopacities in the alimentary tract on radiographs due to smooth oval latex covered drug packets in GIT, generally brought in by law enforcement officers or the smuggler can develop symptoms of intestinal obstruction.

questions.text: What is the abnormality noted in the Given CT scan ?
questions.solution: the image shows hypodensity in the region of basal ganglia suggestive of Lacunar infarct

questions.text: What is the abnormality shown in this shoulder Radiograph?
questions.solution: the shoulder radiograph shows empty glenoid cavity and electric bulb appearance of the head of humerus suggestive of posterior dislocation of shoulder

choices.text: Equalisation of Upper Lobe and Lower lobe vessels

questions.text: Sequential Arrangement Arrange the radiographic findings of Congestive Heart Failure in sequential order with earlier changes first and advanced findings later.

choices.text: I-123 is used for radioablation of thyroid gland
I-123 is used for Functional Thyroid scan

questions.text:
Multiple Completion type
Regarding Radioactive Iodine
questions.solution:
Assertion –Reason type

(A) Tungsten filament is used as cathode in Conventional Xray tube

(B) Tungsten has a high melting point close to 3400 degree Celsius

Answer – Both Assertion and Reason are independently true/correct and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion

(A) Tungsten filament is used as cathode in Conventional Xray tube

(B) Tungsten has a high melting point close to 3400 degree Celsius

questions.text: Identify the given condition
questions.solution:
• The Given images show wide and open anterior fontanella on skull radiograph,Absent Clavicle with approximation of shoulders in the clinical image suggestive of Cleidocranial Dysostosis
  • Cleidocranial Dysostosis can be spontaneous or autosomal dominant defect mainly effecting Membranous ossification characterized by delayed closure of cranial sutures, hypoplastic or aplastic clavicles, short stature, dental abnormalities and a variety of other skeletal abnormalities
  • Cleidocranial dysplasia (CCD) (cleido= clavicle,cranial =head dysplasia)

questions.text: What is the type of fracture shown here?
questions.solution: Hangman fracture/Traumatic Spondylolisthesis of Axis(C2) is a fracture which involves both pars interarticularis of the C2 vertebra . It is typically the result of a hyperextension and distraction injury.

questions.text: Identify the given condition
questions.solution:
• Sprengel deformity, or congenital elevation of the scapula, is the most common congenital shoulder abnormality
  • Commonly associated with presence of Omovertebral Bone

questions.text: Comet Tail Sign On CT-Chest is seen with
questions.solution: Bronchi and vessels curving towards periphery and converging on to a mass like area adjacent to thickened pleura-feature of round atelectasis

questions.text: A 52 year old woman with exertional dyspnea, recurrent transient ischemic attacks, light headedness with sudden changes in position and a 7 kg weight loss over the past 6 months, undergoes Cardiac CT - Scan. The Given CT Scan is suggestive of?
questions.solution: Chambers of Heart

questions.text: The Given Chest radiograph suggests the diagnosis of
questions.solution: • The CXR Shows enlargement of left ventricle with cardiac apex displaced downwards and to the left along with prominent ascending and thorasic aorta suggestive of chronic aortic regurgitation.

questions.text: 70 year old male suffered stroke after recent MI, CECT Images given indicate
questions.solution:
• Series of cect image at the level of cardiac apex show a nonenhancing Rounded thrombus in the left ventricle.

Intraventricular thrombi especially LV thrombi are common after acute MI and present with embolic episodes stroke,limb ischemia

Intraatrial thrombi are common after Atrial fibrillation/mitral stenosis

Lack of Contrast enhancement helps differentiate thrombus from other cardiac tumors

Myxomas generally arise from interatrial septum projecting into left atrium

Echocardiography is the imaging modality of choice for intracardiac thrombi

questions.text: A 65 yr old woman with jugular venous distension, ascites and peripheral edema
questions.solution:
• The Non Contrast CT image demonstrates pericardial thickening with prominent calcification typical of constrictive pericarditis
  • Constrictive Pericarditis has thickening of pericardium > 4mm with pericardial calcifications in about 50% cases, causes diastolic dysfunction and manifests features of Rt Heart Failure.
  • Pericardial stripping/resection of pericardium(pericardiectomy) is done for these patients

questions.text: The Given Chest radiograph suggests the diagnosis of
questions.solution:
• Chest Radiograph in mitral stenosis usually shows about normal size of heart except for left Atrial Enlargement
  • Other Important features of mitral stenosis
  • Straightening of left heart border
  • Lifting up of left main bronchus,splaying of carina
  • Double Right Heart border due to left atrial enlargement
  • Indentation of anterior aspect of esophagus on Barium studies by enlarged Left Atrium
  • Pulmonary congestion and edema in advanced stages

choices.text: High Signal on Diffusion Weighted Mri
Low Signal on Diffusion Weighted Mri

questions.text: Which of the following is a radiological finding of Epidermoid Cyst?
questions.solution: Epidermoid Cysts appear bright on Diffusion Weighted Mri (Diffusion Restriction) and have low ADC value Arachnoid cyst doesnot show diffusion restriction and has low signal on Diffusion Weighted Mri and has high ADC value. Diffusion Weighted MRI is very useful to distinguish Epidermoid Cyst from Arachnoid Cyst.

questions.text: A 25 year old female becomes progressively lethargic, confused and develops generalized tonic clonic seizures after multiple episodes of diarrhea and vomitings for the past two weeks, Mri reveals High signal areas in Parasagittal cortex bilaterally on Flair images, probable cause
questions.solution:
• The given history typically suggests a dehydrated patient with venous sinus thrombosis, most commonly the superior sagittal sinus thrombosis which affect the parasagittal areas bilaterally and donot conform to a particular arterial territory

Empty Delta sign-Superior Sagittal sinus thrombosis

questions.text: Breast within a Breast on Mammography is seen in?
questions.solution:
• The breast within a breast appearence refers to the mammographic appearance of breast hamartomas (fibroadenolipomas).
  • These benign lesions are well-circumscribed and as the name goes fibro-adeno-lipomas contain a mixture of fibrous, glandular and fatty tissue resembling a normal breast which also has fibroglandular and fatty tissue.

questions.text: The Following MRI of the spine denotes
questions.solution: T1 AND T2W Mri image demonstrating Syrinx/Syringomyelia following fluid signal intensities on MRI, commonly involve cervical spinal cord.

questions.text: Which of the following is associated with Neurofibromatosis type 1?
questions.solution: • Sphenoid wing hypoplasia, especially Greater wing of sphenoid producing 'Bare Orbit sign' in Neurofibromatosis type 1

questions.text: PACS in medical imaging stands for:
questions.solution: Picture archiving communication system

questions.text: A Radiological sign of meningioma:
questions.solution: • Meningiomas show intense contrast enhancement with Early enhancement and Delayed Washout(Early to come and Late to Go) which has been referred to as Mother in Law Sign

questions.text: Which of the following investigation is most sensitive for localization of adenomas of parathyroid gland?
questions.solution: Sestamibi scan is done to localise parathyroid adenomas

questions.text: Spongy appearance with central sunburst calcification is seen in?
questions.solution: Serouscyst adenoma is microcystic with central sunburst calcification, common in elderly females (Grandmother lesion) and is benign

questions.text: The radio-isotope used for lymph node scanning is:
questions.solution: It is taken up by lymphocytes and thus can be used in lymphnnode scanning

questions.text: Most common hormone deficiency seen after intracranial radiation therapy:
questions.solution: Growth hormone is the most common hormone deficiency after intracranial radiation therapy

questions.text: Comment on the pic below?
questions.solution: • The image shows an Anechoic (black)area between liver and Right Kidney in the Morrisons pouch suggestive of Fluid indicating Hemoperitoneum and is considered as FAST positive

questions.text: All lung carcinomas for diagnosis requires CECT thorax but MRI is useful in which of the following-
questions.solution:
• Pancoast Tumors are Lung Cancers located at apicopleuropulmonary groove(superior sulcus)
  • MRI is preferred in the evaluation of Pancoast tumor especially to evaluate tumor extension into brachial plexus, subclavian vessels, pleural and neurovertebral foramina and spinal cord involvement

questions.text: Gamma Rays are used in?
questions.solution:
• PET Scan uses Gamma Rays
  • Gamma Rays are used in SCINTIGRAPHY STUDIES(Tc99m radioisotope studies). SPECT(Single Photon Emission Computerised Tomography) studies and PET scan (Positron Emission Tomography)
  • All other investigations given in the options use X rays

questions.text: Photostimulable Phosphor Plate is used in
questions.solution:
• Photostimulable Phosphor Plate is used in Computerised Radiography
  • Conventional X ray Film is made of emulsions of Silver Halide mainly Silver Bromide.

questions.text: A Young Boy with frequent seizures undergoes Mri, which shows Cortical based Bubbly Brain Tumor on T2W MRI, it is suggestive of?
questions.solution:
Dysembryoplastic neuroepithelial tumors (DNET) are benign (WHO Grade I) slow growing Cortical based glioneuronal tumors found mainly during the first few decades of life CORTICAL/superficial location, usually in the temporal lobe but always supratentorial in location, skull remodeling occurs due to the slow growth of the lesion. This cortical mass usually presents with long-standing seizures.


  • Imaging findings include Well circumscribed ,Wedge-shaped 'bubbly' cortical mass with lack of surrounding edema and mass effect.
  • CT findings include Wedge-shaped low density Cortical/subcortical lesion with Scalloped inner table
  • MR imaging the mass is low intensity on T1-weighted images and markedly hyperintense on T2-weighted images giving a 'pseudocystic' or bubbly appearance With no diffusion restriction
  • oligodendroglioma, Ganglioglioma, Pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma are other differentials

questions.text: Remote After Loading is done in?
questions.solution: Remote after loading is a technique used in Brachytherapy where the surgeon keeps empty pellets in the tumour which is later filled remotely by a computer controlled mechanism with radioisotopes, thus preventing radiation exposure to surgeon and patients normal tissues

questions.text: The Sign seen on Ultrasound when the Common Femoral Vein meets the GSV and Femoral Artery at the Saphenofemoral Junction is called?
questions.solution: The cfa, cfv and saphenofemoral junction at the region of thigh take the shape of Mickey Mouse sign on doppler ultrasound

questions.text: Radiation Dose Monitoring in Occupational Workers is done by
questions.solution: Radiation dose monitoring is done by TLD batch, it is made of LIF/caso4 dysprosium and is worn under the lead apron at chest level and is read every 3 months.

questions.text: 45 yrs old female presented with abdominal colic, Jaundice,Serum Bilirubin Levels are Elevated,GGT is increased,USG reveals scleroatrophic Gall Bladder and Dilated CBD with Impacted stones,What is Next Step Of Management?
questions.solution: The patient seems to be having distal CBD stone and ERCP is diagnostic and therapeutic for distal cbd stones.

questions.text: CT scan image of a solid-cystic Lesion with calcification in sellar region is given,Probable Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Solid cystic mass In the sella with calcification in the suprasellar region is suggestive of Craniopharyngioma

questions.text: A Radiograph is obtained from a Child with skeletal abnormality ,what is the name of the angle being measured?
questions.solution: Cobbs angle is used to measure scoliosis and angle more than 10 is suggestive of scoliosis

questions.text: A 7 week pregnant lady underwent a Chest X ray by mistake, what is to be done-?
questions.solution:
Risk of fetal damage after radiation exposure is minimal and a radiation dose of <5 rad are not associated with any significant fetal damage and do not warrant termination.

Most diagnostic modalities fall below this threshold

questions.text: A patient presents with swelling in the neck, regurgitation and gurgling sound when pressed, What is the most likely Diagnosis of following Barium Swallow Image?
questions.solution: The barium swallow image shows a posterior midline outpouching suggestive of zenkers diverticulum

questions.text: A female undergoing treatment for infertility with IVF was given Inj.HCG, presents with history of vomiting, nausea, and headache.The Usg is shown as below,what is the diagnosis ?
questions.solution: Bilaterally enlarged Ovaries with multiple large cysts, in a patient undergoing ivf treatment should indicate OHSS

questions.text: 35 year old male presenting with recurrent episodes of abdominal pain, jaundice and fatigue underwent MRCP, The most likely diagnosis is?
questions.solution: MRCP image shows multiple strictures and dilations suggesting a prune tree appearance of primary sclerosing cholangitis

questions.text: A female patient with clinical symptoms of systemic sclerosis presents shortness of breath and b/l basal rates, Her CXR showed reticular opacities in B/L basal fields. What is the Next Best Step-?
questions.solution: IOC for a patient with suspected ILD is HRCT

questions.text: Occipito Mental View with Open Mouth,Best Described by which X ray-?
questions.solution:
Occipito mental view with open mouth is Pierre View

Occipito Mental View with closed mouth is Waters view

choices.text: Rapidly dividing cells are resistant to Radiation
GI mucosa is one of the most radioresistant tissue in the body
The intensity of Radiation is inversely proportional to the square of distance from the source
Small blood vessels are least resistant to radiation

questions.text: CANCER Patient, Radiosensitivity of tissues, pick the true statement-?
questions.solution: Inverse square law states intensity of radiation is inversely proportional to square of distance from source

questions.text: A middle Aged man complains of abdominal pain after a heavy meal. Xray shows Widening of mediastinum with Pneumomediastinum,Probable Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Pneumomediastinum in a patient after heavy meal suggests esophageal perforation

choices.text: More efficient in detecting osteolytic mets
More efficient in detecting osteoblastic mets
Can be used as bone scan to detect secondaries
Can be used to diagnose osteomyelitis

questions.text: Which is not true regarding technetium 99 MDP
questions.solution:
Major drawbacks of Tc99m Bone Scan-

Low specificity,

Planar imaging

Poor resolution images

impaired sensitivity in axial skeleton and lytic metastases

  • Osteoblastic mets are more easily seen with Tc-99m MDP and F-18 NaF PET
  • F-18 FDG is superior for lytic areas.
  • High sensitivity for lytic and blastic lesions- F-18 NaF PET/CT

questions.text: Which of the following differentiates a bone mets from a primary bone tumour?
questions.solution:
• Bone mets are often multiple, especially involve red bone marrow mainly axial skeleton vertebra, pelvis, ribs
  • Proximal femur and humerus
  • UNCOMMON DISTAL TO ELBOW OR KNEE
  • Can have georgraphic, moth eaten or permeative pattern but less periosteal reaction than primary lesion
  • It is important to note that unlike primary bone tumours, in general metastases incite no or only limited periosteal reaction.
  • The occasional exception to this general rule includes prostate cancer, retinoblastoma and neuroblastoma.
  • Breast ca-mainly lytic lesions, 10% osteoblastic,and 10% mixed,
  • commonest cause of osteoblastic mets in woman
  • Prostrate mets-osteoblastic with periosteal reaction giving sunburst appearance resembling osteosarcoma
  • Renal Lytic expansile and hypervascular
  • Thyroid lytic and expansile
  • Bladder-lytic and predilection for lower limbs
  • COLON-usually lytic
  • PROSTRATE, Carcinoid, medulloblastoma, hodgkins lymphoma-osteoblastic

questions.text: Radio sensitizer for head and neck cancer is
questions.solution:
'Cisplatin is a potent radiosensitizer and the drug traditionally used for chemotherapy in head and neck cancers'

RADIOSENSITIZERS:

Radiosensitizers are drugs that make cancer cells more susceptible to damage by radiation therapy. These drugs act by increasing the normally low level of oxygen in the cancer cells.

Cancers with low levels of oxygen are less sensitive to radiation than cancers with normal or high levels.

Radiosensitizers used in head and neck cancers:

Cisplatin

Paclitaxel

RSR 13

Nimorazole

Cetuximab

questions.text:
A 65 year old male with history of recent weight loss undergoes ultrasound Abdomen which shows hypoechoic lesions in the liver surrounded by a halo and on CECT examination the following image is obtained as given below, The lesions do not show significant enhancement on arterial or delayed phase.
The Patient is known hypertensive, diabetic and a chronic smoker, what could be the possible diagnosis
questions.solution:
The CECT image shows multiple hypodense lesions which are not enhancing in arterial or delayed phase, in a elderly smoker with recent weight loss suggests secondaries in the liver Ultrasound shows bulls eye or target like lesions having a hypoechoic halo

  • In HCC, the classic finding on CECT imaging is early arterial enhancement with rapid washout in the portal (venous) and delayed phases.
  • Hemangioma shows initial peripheral nodular enhancement in arterial phase and homogenous centripetal enhancement in delayed phase
  • Carolis disease shows central Dot sign

questions.text: A 50-year-old male smoker patient with long standing hypertension develops chest pain. ECG shows ST segment elevation and Q waves. Myocardial necrosis in this patient can be best demonstrated by:
questions.solution:
• Technetium 99 Pyrophosphate is used for myocardial infarction
  • Myocardial infarction appears HOT on Pyrophosphate scan
  • Technetium 99 tetrofosmin, sestamibi scan and thallium scan are for Myocardial Perfusion imaging
  • N-13 Ammonia PET is more sensitive for myocardial perfusion imaging
  • 18 FDG PET is used for myocardial viability.

questions.text: A 60 year old diabetic male presents to the emergency with acute onset abdominal pain, mainly in the Rt Upper Quadrant Ultrasound abdomen was done and showed Echogenic foci in the Gall bladder, CT scan was performed and the following image is obtained as shown below, what is the likely cause for this patients symptoms?
questions.solution:
• The Ct scan image shows air in the gallbladder wall in a elderly diabetic patient suggestive of Emphysematous Cholecystitis
  • Emphysematous cholecystitis is a form of acute cholecystitis and a surgical emergency
  • Carries risk of gallbladder gangrene and perforation and high mortality
  • Ultrasonography may demonstrate highly echogenic reflectors with low-level posterior shadowing and reverberation artifacts and champagne sign (echogenic foci rising up from the lumen of Gall bladder)
  • CT is considered the most sensitive and specific imaging modality for identifying gas within the gallbladder lumen or wall
  • HIDA scan may demonstrate the RIM sign

questions.text: Annual recommended radiation dose limit for general public is
questions.solution: AERB Guidelines for Radiation protection

questions.text: A 5 year old Boy with progressive motor and cognitive and visual defects, MRI Brain obtained from the child is shown. The Given Condition shows accumulation of which of the following compounds
questions.solution:
• Given MRI image of the child suggests Adrenoleukodystrophy, a X linked Recessive condition, common in Males
  • The conditions result from the accumulation of very long-chain fatty acids (VLCFAs) due to genetic deficiency in the peroxisomal oxidation of fatty acids.
  • There is involvement of deep white matter in the b/l parieto-occipital lobes and splenium of the corpus callosum

choices.text: The involved structure is inserted on greater trochanter of femur
Secondary Spread of infection from gastrointestinal tract/Kidneys can lead to this condition
MRI is the most useful investigation to assess the associated involvement of Spine
The involved structure is a hip Flexor

questions.text: A 45 yr old diabetic male presents to the OPD with back pain and fever. He is limping while walking, He also gives history of low grade on and off fever and weight loss since 2 months. On examination the patient complains of intense pain on passive extension of the left hip. MRI scan was performed to evaluate backache and is given below, All the following statements are true regarding this patients condition except?
questions.solution:
Psoas Major inserts on the lesser trochanter of femur and is a hip flexor

MRI image depicting normal psoas major muscle on coronal and Axial T2W MRI

choices.text: The Facial Lesion commonly involves Opthalmic Division of Trigeminal Nerve
Cortical, Gyriform Calcification and Glaucoma are common
Hemiatrophy of Brain is seen on same side of the facial mark

questions.text:
A Young Child presents with seizures, refractory to medication, He is mentally retarded and shows focal neurological deficits on examination, He has a peculiar purple-red mark on one side of his face since birth. CT scan is obtained and the image is given below.



All are True about this childs condition except?
questions.solution:
• The Given image and clinical history of the child suggests the diagnosis of Sturge Weber Syndrome
  • It is a sporadic nonhereditary disorder
  • It is charecterised by Port wine stain on the face involving ophthalmic division of trigeminal nerve, Glaucoma, leptomeningeal angiomas, Cortical Gyriform Calcifications, Hemiatrophy of Brain, and seizures contralateral to portwine stain

choices.text: Pseudosacculations involving antimesentric side of the bowel
Deep penetrating thorn-like ulcers and fissures in thickened bowel wall

questions.text: A 28 year old female patient presents with abdominal pain and diarrhea since 5 days. She gives history of similar on and off episodes since two years. She has lost significant weight since then. On examination, she is anemic, has gingivitis and pain and tenderness in the right lower quadrant of the abdomen, CT scan demonstrated areas of bowel wall thickening with prominent engorged vasa recta in the mesentry, All the following are true about this patients condition except :-
questions.solution:
• The History suggests Inflammatory bowel disease with clues of gingivitis, pain in right lower quadrant(Ileitis) and Comb sign on CT scan (prominent vasa recta) suggests Crohns disease
  • It is charecterised by skip lesions, transmural involvement with fissures, fistulas and longitudinal deep ulcers
  • Ulcerative colitis shows continuous involvement from rectum upwards

questions.text: A 65 year old hypertensive male patient was rushed to the Emergency with complaints of left sided chest pain radiating to left arm, sweating and palpitations. Emergency physician suspected myocardial infarction and ordered an emergency ECG which revealed ST Elevation suggesting an anterolateral wall MI. Echocardiogram showed impaired movement of the anterior wall of left ventricle. He was treated medically and discharged After 2 weeks, A month later while doing his regular household work, he felt weakness of his left arm and left leg. NCCT brain showed wedge shaped hypodense area involving Grey white matter interface in Rt MCA territory. Chest radiograph was also obtained and is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
• The patient with a recent history of MI with thromboembolic episode and Chest Radiograph showing focal lateral bulge in left lower lateral border of heart is suggestive of Left Ventricular Aneurysm.
  • Left Ventricular Aneurysm can develop intramural thrombus which can dislodge and lead to thromboembolic episodes like Brain Infarction

questions.text: A 65-year-old man with presents with seizures, He had recently developed headache and frequent vomitings. On examination he has papilledema. He is afebrile. CT head shows a hypodense area in the left frontal lobe. MRI brain shows a irregular lesion showing necrotic areas within and thick peripheral enhancement. The lesion is seen infiltrating the Genu of corpus callosum and extending into right hemisphere, No calcification is seen. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: • The elderly male patient showing signs of increased ICT with imaging showing a infiltrative lesion with peripheral wall enhancement invading corpus callosum crossing midline is suggestive of Glioblastoma Multiformis

choices.text: Follow up CT after one year

questions.text: A 35 year old underwent chest radiograph as part of a routine health check up for his employment, Chest Radiograph revealed a nodule in Right lung. He has no history of fever, weight loss, chest pain or hemoptysis. CT scan obtained from the patient is given below. Which of the following should be the most appropriate next step of management?
questions.solution:
• The irregular spiculated lesion on Chest CT in this patient makes us suspicious of malignancy and warrant CT GUIDED BIOPSY to establish a histological diagnosis.
  • Incidental pulmonary nodules, are an extremely common finding on Imaging
  • Prior CXRs and CT scans should be obtained if available for comparison. and the probability of cancer, determined according to the patient's smoking history, age, and characteristics on imaging
  • A PET scan may be useful if the lesion are greater in size and if CT Guided biopsy is not feasible

questions.text: A 2 year old child presents with seizures and a scalp swelling which has been increasing in size since past few months, He has a history of fall with head injury 6 months back, NCCT Head at the time of head injury showed fracture of parietal bone. CT scan taken now is shown below. what is the Likely Diagnosis ?
questions.solution:
• Leptomeningeal cysts, also known as growing skull fractures, are an enlarging skull fracture that occurs post-trauma
  • majority occur in children <3 years and can present with
  • enlarging scalp mass
  • seizures
  • focal neurological deficits and headache
  • CT scan is the modality of choice for the evaluation of leptomeningeal cyst.
  • It consists of a lytic calvarial lesion with scalloped edges, in which encephalomalacia invaginates.

questions.text:
A 10 year old boy presents with acute onset abdominal pain, and an episode of vomiting,He also gives history of recent loss of appetite. The Abdomen is soft but tender especially around the periumbilical region, Ultrasound abdomen is done and the following image obtained is shown.



All the following statements are true regarding this condition except?
questions.solution:
• The ultrasound image and the history given point towards Acute Appendicitis in the child
  • On Usg Acute Appendicitis presents as blind ending tubular structure, which is noncompressible, aperistaltic showing luminal diameter more than 6 mm and wall thickening and sometimes a fecolith within

questions.text: A 10 year old presents with persistent cough that has not responded to antibiotics. He was frequently hospitalised past few years with repeated pulmonary infections, CXR obtained is shown below What will you do next to confirm the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
• The Chest Radiograph shows a triangular opacity near left paracardiac region along with the history of repeated pulmonary infections in a child suggests towards pulmonary sequestration
  • Pulmonary sequestration refers to the aberrant formation of segmental lung tissue that has no connection with the bronchial tree or pulmonary arteries
  • There are two types:
    • Intralobar sequestration
    • Extralobar sequestration
  • Pulmonary Sequestration has a systemic arterial supply which is usually a branch of the aorta :

questions.text: A 3 year old boy is brought to the clinic by his parents who noticed multiple soft, blue nodules on his right hand, These bluish nodules get emptied by manual compression by the examiner. The Childs hand X-ray is shown. What is the likely diagnosis.
questions.solution:
• The Radiograph shows multiple Enchondromas with soft tissue masses showing phleboliths suggestive of hemangiomas
  • Maffucci syndrome is a congenital nonhereditary mesodermal dysplasia characterized by multiple Enchondromas and soft tissue Hemangiomas

questions.text: A 25-yr-old male had a fall from his bike and sustained trauma to his head. He is complaining of bleeding from his right ear and decreased hearing from his right ear NCCT of the Head is advised and the image obtained is shown below. what is the likely diagnosis in this patient ?
questions.solution: The image shows Longitudnal fracture of the Rt petrous temporal bone

choices.text: I-125 is used for treatment of this patient
Killing of the cancer cells is by Gamma Rays emitted by the radioiodine
Radioiodine in this patient is given by oral route

questions.text: A 25 year old girl with thyroid swelling underwent ultrasound neck which shows heterogenous hypoechoic lesion with calcifications in the rt lobe of thyroid, Radioiodine therapy was started after thyroid surgery, which of the following statements is true regarding the treatment received by the patient
questions.solution:
lodine-125

  • Iodine-125, half life-60
  • Commonly used in brachytherapy in the treatment of cancer especially in prostate cancer
  • It is also widely used in Radioimmunoassay

lodine-123

  • Half-life-13 hours.
  • Has no beta activity only gamma activity and is used in thyroid scintigraphy/functional scan/radioactive iodine uptake/RAlU).

lodine-131

  • Half life-8 days.,used by systemic route mainly orally
  • widely used for localizing and treating thyroid cancer and thyroid metastasis and in imaging the thyroid.
  • 1-131 has both a beta and gamma decay.
  • Destruction of thyroid tissue by lodine-131 is due to emission of Beta Rays.
  • The high energy beta radiation from 1-131 causes it to be the most carcinogenic of the iodine isotopes.

lodine-124

lodine-124 is positron emitter used in PET scan

questions.text: A 3 year old female child presents with seizures and signs of increased ICT, Her past history reveals that she is on antiarrhythmic drugs, and her General Examination shows following skin lesions, Her CT scan revealed a lesion at the Foramen of Monro. What other finding can be associated in this patient?
questions.solution:
• This patient is suffering from Tuberous sclerosis
  • The Most common finding is the presence of Hypopigmented patches over the trunk suggestive of Ash-Leaf Macules
  • The lesion at foramen of Monro is SEGA(Subependymal Giant cell Astrocytoma)
  • Cardiac lesions can be Cardiac Rhabdomyomas which can be the reason the child was on Antiarrhytmic drugs
  • Cns lesions like cortical tubers, subependymal calcifications and SEGA are associated leading to seizures and features of raised ICT
  • Lungs can show presence of Multiple lung cysts suggestive of Lymphangioleiomyomatosis in later stages of the disease
  • Angiofibromas of the face (Adenoma Sebacium) are common findings in these patients
  • Kidneys can show Bilateral Angiomyolipomas

choices.text: Prominent Pulmonary vessels extening till periphery of the Xray film bilaterally
Small Aortic Knuckle on chest Radiograph

questions.text: A 12 year-old female child presented to the OPD with complaints of repeated episodes of respiratory infections. Examination revealed crepitations and Rhonchi in bilateral lung fields along with a wide fixed split second heart sound. A congenital Heart defect is suspected in this child All of the following are true about the chest radiograph findings of this condition except:
questions.solution:
• Wide Fixed Splitting of Second heart sound in this child suggests towards ASD

Radiological findings of ASD

  • Normal Size of Left Atrium and Left Ventricle
  • Enlarged Right Atrium and Right Ventricle
  • Enlarged main Pulmonary Artery with vessels extending into the lateral third of lung fields bilaterally
  • Small Aortic Knuckle and aortic arch

questions.text: A 50-year-old male presents with fever and seizures, He has headache and few episodes of vomitings since 3 days. His Vitals are stable but temp is 101.1F On examination he has papilledema but otherwise examination is unremarkable with no focal neurological deficit. His CRP levels are elevated. He undergoes CT head with contrast which shows a diffusely infiltrating necrotic mass having irregular peripheral enhancement, no calcification is noted in the lesion, On MRI the lesion shows Diffussion Restriction What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: • Febrile patient showing a peripheral Ring enhancing lesion which shows diffusion restriction on MRI suggests Cerebral Abscess

questions.text: A well defined round hyperdense lesion located at anteriosuperior aspect of third ventricle, near foramen of monro and hyperintense on T1 can be?
questions.solution:
• Colloid cysts of the third ventricle are benign epithelial lined cysts with characteristic imaging features,usually found incidentally and asymptomatic, they can rarely present with acute hydrocephalus.
  • Classically these cysts are identified as a well-delineated hyperattenuated masses on NCCT, attached to the anterosuperior portion of the third ventricle. On MRI they usually are hyperintense on T1
  • They are located at the foramen of Monro
  • Colloid cysts originate from the abnormal folding of the primitive neuro-epithelium (the paraphysis elements) . They contain mucin, old blood (haemosiderin), cholesterol accounting for a wide range of imaging appearance.
  • These cysts are lined by a single layer of columnar epithelium which produces mucin,

questions.text: A score of BIRADS-6 on mammography indicates:
Widened Bat wing sylvian fissures is associated with?
questions.solution:
Bat wing sylvian fissure-Glutaric aciduria type 1



Axial T2W MR Image reveals fronto-temporal atrophy, dilated sylvian fissures with open opercula (straight arrow), diffuse white matter signal abnormality and bilateral high signal in the basal ganglia (curved arrow).
Widening of the sylvian fissure giving characteristic 'bat-wing' appearance GLUTARIC ACIDURIA TYPE 1

questions.text: Hot Cross Bun sign is seen in?
questions.solution: Multisystem Atrophy type-C

questions.text: Which stage of Hematoma in Brain is Hyperintense On T1?
Hematopoeitic effects after acute radiation exposure occur at a dose of?
18FDG PET UPTAKE IN A ASSYMPTOMATIC PERSON IS SHOWN, IT SUGGESTS
questions.solution:
• Human brown adipose tissue detected by fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG)-positron emission tomography (PET). FDG uptake into adipose tissue at the supraclavicular and paraspinal regions is detected by PET. The FDG uptake into adipose tissues is negligible under a warm condition at 27°C(A), but increases greatly after exposure to cold at 19°C(B) for 2 hours
  • Symmetrical uptake in Bilateral Supraclavicular and Paraspinal Brown Adipose Tissue
